name: Giglio Bianco B&B

reviews.text: I have stayed with the gracious and fabulously hospitable Varinia and Edoardo a few times in the past with tremendous satisfaction, but on this trip, scheduled at the last minute, there were no rooms available. So, instead, I visited them for a dinner.... AND WHAT A DINNER IT WAS!
reviews.title: The dinner is THAT good!

reviews.text: Varinia is an outstanding chef, and Edoardo is an informative and engaging host. With each course that came to our table, Edoardo explained the amazing concoction, and then quietly disappeared so that the two tables could savour each bite.
reviews.title: The best in Italy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was AMAZING - easily the best meal I've ever had in Italy (and possibly anywhere else). Each of the five courses was relentlessly tasty, beautifully presented, and personalized (I am veggie, my friend is not, and a chap at the other table didn't like tomatoes (try cooking a Tuscan meal without tomatoes for a challenge!)) The wine (and dessert wines at the end) was also delectable.
reviews.title: Eduardo & Varinia are the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On top of the sheer quality of the meal, the ambiance of the evening was gorgeous. The weather was warm so the big windows overlooking the Boboli Gardens were swung wide open, and little candles were lit on the window sill and elsewhere around the lovely, eclectic room. A great mix of music played in the background.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all it is a unique experience - Stunning food, perfect ambience, in an remarkably intimate, comfortable setting. Really, it is not to be missed. Even if you can not get a room at the B&B, I would recommend that you try to experience one of Varinia's sublime dinners.
reviews.title: Edoardo and Varinia are gifted hosts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this to be a very convenient base for exploring the sights of Forence and although not in the very centre, was within a short walk of the main sights.
reviews.title: Quiet room, friendly hosts, convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our hosts were very helpful and friendly and the room clean and quiet.
reviews.title: Fabulous Florence Find!

reviews.text: There is a very good reasonably priced restaurant about 10mins walk away -'Casalinga'.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place to Stay in Florence
The BEST service in all of Italy- hands down!
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights as part of our honeymoon and it was simply wonderful. Eduardo and Varinia (the owners) could not have been more helpful. Eduardo gave us superb recommendations for places to eat for lunch and evening meals, provided us with a mobile phone in case of any problems and helped us pre-book gallery visits. Varinia cooked up wonderful breakfasts and also an evening meal which was one of the best meals we had while in Italy. (Certainly book in for a meal if you do not intend to stay here!) Our room was spacious, clean and well appointed and was in a great location to walk and explore the city. The service was superb - Eduardo and Varinia were there if you needed them but also gave you freedom and space to enjoy your visit and to come and go as you please.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What we liked best was the price of the accommodation given its location and the food and service provided. We have no criticisms and would have no hesitation in recommending it for your stay in Florence.
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights and I couldn't be happier with our decision. The location was great as it was within walking distance of Ponte Vecchio and other sights within Florence. The room was clean, very spacious and welcoming. The bathrooms were spotless. Breakfast was very good and made fresh by Varinia. Internet is also provided which we found to be handy. But the best thing about this B&B is the incredible service that is provided by Edoardo and Varnia. They go out of their way to help make your stay in Florence as perfect as possible. From the time we arrived from the day we departed they treated us with kindness and were so helpful in making the most of our day trips with tips and directions. Edoardo even phoned a reservation for a bike tour we wanted to do. They are such wonderful people and I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else the next time we come back to Florence. Also, don't miss the opportunity to have Chef Varinia cook you a specially created dinner just for you. I saw reviews of her dinners and decided to give it a try. Wow! My wife and I were blown away by how delicious and fresh the four course dinner was. Definately a highlight of our trip.
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B with fantastic hosts

reviews.text: This was home for two days at the end of a two week trip to Tuscany. I was tired. I was grumpy! Varinia and Edoardo took me in, gave me a huge room by Florence standards and fed me well.
reviews.title: Yep, it's #1 for a reason

reviews.text: I like this Oltrarno location. Florence in general is very easy to navigate and I'm glad to be away from the tourists. (Uh, yes, I'm aware that would be me.) Be warned the apartment is on the 2nd floor (0,1,2) and there will be lots of stairs involved. Once inside the home is charming. The back area with the two guest rooms is large and comfortable. They also have the best internet connection I've had in two weeks. (There's a computer you can use if you don't tote your own.) Since I'm kind of a junkie, that makes this place golden. Finally, the back rooms are very, very quiet. I had a great deal of privacy. The neighborhood feels very safe.
reviews.title: Fantastic Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you travel to get a sense of local living, this is really your best choice in Florence. If you travel with value in mind this is a great choice, too.
reviews.title: Don't Let First Impressions Fool You!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Giglio Bianco with wife and young son early in September. Varinia and Edoardo were so helpful in making us feel relaxed and ensuring that we knew where to head off to in Florence, including booking tickets for the museums and where the bext ice cream is to be had!
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I brought my boyfriend to Florence as a surprise for his 30th Birthday and I could not have chosen a better spot to take him. Florence is wonderful and Giglio Bianco B&B is delightful!! The B&B is located just past the Pitti Palace/ Boboli Gardens so is really central - no more than a 5 min walk to the Ponte Vecchico. The apartment itself is in a beautiful old building with high ceilings and wooden floorboards. The rooms are really gorgeous – there are only two rooms in the B&B so it is intimate and quiet. We stayed in the green room but I did have a peek at the red room and it looked fab too. Breakfast was nice. Light but fine.
reviews.title: Varina and Eduoardo couldn't do enough for us - thanks so much!!
Comfortable B&B
reviews.text: Varina and Eduardo are very friendly hosts and will provide you with any information that you need. For us they really did go beyond the call of duty. As part of my boyfriend's birthday present, I wanted to take him to a soccer game. Unfortunately it didn’t work out but Varina and Eduardo tried so hard. They rang the fan clubs in Milan and Florence and queuing for tickets an hour before the ticket booth even opened! Thank you so much guys!!! We really did appreciate all your effort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now onto the dinner.....deliciously tasty. Varina is a wonderful cook and the food really was the best we had on our trip. It’s not just the way she cooks it - although she is excellent - it’s also the ingredients they use which are top notch. Loved the dinner and was a perfect consolation prize for my boyfriend missing the soccer game.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I recommend Giglio Bianco?? Definitely. 5 star FANTASTICO!!
reviews.title: The perfect B&B in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful time at Giglio Bianco B&B in early May. We stayed at the "Green" room which is quite at all time, bed is extremely comfortable, the location is fantastic, in a safe residential part of town within 10-20 minutes comfortable walk to all attractions. Host Varinia and Edoardo really try their best to make our stay as comfortable as possible. They provide a short introduction of Florence as soon as you arrive, some useful maps and tour books for your review and will make museum and dinner reservations upon request. Drinking water is available at all time. We tried the 5 courses Tuscany dinner prepared by host/chef Varinia, the experience was like enjoying a homemade cooking in a romantic restaurant, we totally love it. During our stay, I accidentally broke one of the windows in my bedroom, Edoardo's first reaction was if I were ok, and then calmly told me not to be worried (I still feel bad at this moment). When we came back to our room in the afternoon, the window was fixed and my room was spotless clean, no trace of any broken glasses at all. This incident shows just how caring and how professtional they are. This is our first time trying B&B, we always stay at hotels, Varinia's homemade cooking lured us to stay here and we are glad with our decision. Giglio Bianco B*B's service, level of comfort and the convenience of the location of are simply topnotch.
reviews.title: Great place

description: B&B Boutique a place where you can take a rest and enjoy wonderful food!!!In the centre of Florence very near to Ponte Vecchio and Palazzo Pitti, in Oltrarno quarter, in a typical Florentine house of the sixteenth century. It has 2 delicious quiet bedrooms, with private toilet, furnished with good taste and very comfortable.Before the two bedrooms there is a little livingroom, illuminated through a skylight, where guests can read, consult internet or taste good wine.
